intro: Hutchinsia diffusa, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in loose inflorescences. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed or disturbed habitats. Hutchinsia diffusa is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as hibiscus and cotton.
